data.title: All 116 Bill Murray Movies (in Order)
data.meta_description: Get ready to dive into the world of quirky comedy and memorable performances with our roundup of Bill Murray’s finest movie moments. From “Ghostbusters” to “Lost in Translation, “ we’ve gathered a…
data.text:
Marilyn Perry

·

Follow

44 min read

·

Mar 17, 2024

--

Get ready to dive into the world of quirky comedy and memorable performances with our roundup of Bill Murray’s finest movie moments. From “Ghostbusters” to “Lost in Translation, “ we’ve gathered a collection of his most iconic roles that are sure to leave you laughing and appreciating the legendary talent of this versatile actor.

1. Tarzoon: Shame of the Jungle (1975)

Tarzoon: Shame of the Jungle” (1975) is a wild, grindhouse adventure that spills into the world of sex comedy and satire, taking the jungle adventure genre by storm. Shame, the ape man of the jungle, embarks on a daring quest to rescue his love, June, who has been kidnapped by a ruthless gang of giant penises.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

2. Next Stop, Greenwich Village (1976)

Experience the vibrant, whirlwind life of a group of aspiring young artists in 1950s New York in the comedy-drama, “Next Stop, Greenwich Village”. Directed by Paul Mazursky and written by himself, this film delves into the intimate and complex relationships between these bohemian, beatnik, and gay characters.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

3. Coming Attractions (1978)

Coming Attractions” (1978) is a comedy film that satirically presents a series of movie trailers, featuring an amusing array of absurd titles and subjects. The trailers include “The Howard Huge Story, “ “Skateboarders from Hell, “ “The Invasion of the Penis Snatchers, “ and a pre-Mia Woody Allen. Expect a blend of humor, social commentary, and pop culture references as viewers are taken on a wild ride through a variety of storylines, including war movies, Charlie Chaplin parodies, and a reference to Billy Jack.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

4. The Rutles: All You Need Is Cash (1978)

The Rutles: All You Need Is Cash” is a hilarious spoof mockumentary that takes a jab at the world of rock and roll. The film follows the exploits of the “prefab four, “ a group of British musicians who are portrayed as the most famous band of all time.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

5. Mr. Mike’s Mondo Video (1979)

Step into the wacky world of Mike O’Donoghue’s “Mr. Mike’s Mondo Video, “ a quirky 1979 comedy that celebrates all things odd and unusual. This satirical masterpiece, inspired by “Mondo Cane, “ showcases an eclectic mix of performers, musicians, and celebrity transformations in a series of quirky short films.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

6. Meatballs (1979)

Get ready for a summer filled with hilarious antics and unforgettable moments as Meatballs takes you on a wild ride. Set in a less-than-average summer camp, this slapstick comedy follows a group of eccentric counselors and their eager campers as they embark on a journey of male bonding, adventure, and absurdity. From the moment they step aboard a school bus filled with excitement and trepidation, the campers and counselors dive headfirst into a series of mishaps that are sure to have you laughing out loud.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

7. Caddyshack (1980)

Caddyshack” is a hilarious 1980 comedy sports film that follows an upscale golf course as it struggles to maintain order amid chaos and mischief. The course’s management finds themselves dealing with an obnoxious new member, a flatulent golf aficionado who has a knack for causing trouble. To make matters even more chaotic, a destructive dancing gopher wreaks havoc on the property.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

8. B.C. Rock (1980)

B. C. Rock, “ directed by Picha, is a unique adult animated comedy that takes viewers on a wild ride, tying together rock music and the Dawn of Man in a far-fetched yet entertaining narrative. The film, featuring a soundtrack that includes a mix of rock and comedy elements, transports audiences back to the time of prehistoric man, complete with explicit sexual humor, carnivorous plants, egg-laying, and even bestiality.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

9. Where the Buffalo Roam (1980)

Where the Buffalo Roam, “ a captivating 1980 semi-biographical film, delves into the remarkable life and experiences of gonzo journalist Hunter S. Thompson. This compelling cinematic journey offers a rare look into the world of journalism like no other, taking viewers on a rollercoaster ride of both hilarity and poignant moments.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

10. Polyester (1981)

In the hilarious 1981 comedy Polyester, a suburban housewife’s life takes a shocking turn after discovering her pornographer husband’s infidelities and facing a series of bizarre family dramas. As her daughter becomes pregnant and her son is suspected of being a foot fetishist, the dysfunctional family finds themselves entangled in a web of chaos.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

11. Stripes (1981)

Stripes” is a 1981 comedy film directed by Ivan Reitman and written by Len Blum, Daniel Goldberg, and Harold Ramis. The movie follows the lives of two friends who, disillusioned with their mundane jobs, decide to join the U. S. Army with the hope of gaining a sense of adventure.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

12. Twilight Theatre (1982)

Twilight Theatre, released in 1982, is a delightful 90-minute comedy special that takes audiences on a hilarious journey featuring some of the biggest names in comedy. This entertaining variety show, directed by Perry Rosemond, is known for its lighthearted skits that showcase the talents of renowned comedians.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

13. Tootsie (1982)

Tootsie” is a 1982 American comedy-drama film that stars Dustin Hoffman, Jessica Lange, and Teri Garr. Directed by Sydney Pollack and written by Don McGuire, Larry Gelbart, and Murray Schisgal, the film follows the story of Michael Dorsey, an unsuccessful actor who disguises himself as a woman to secure a role on a trashy hospital soap.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

14. Hollywood: The Gift of Laughter (1982)

Hollywood: The Gift of Laughter” is a captivating documentary that takes viewers on a fascinating journey through the world of film comedy, spanning six decades from the 1920s to the present. This film is not just a celebration of hilarious moments, but also a profound appreciation for the gift of laughter, which has been a constant source of joy and comfort for countless audiences.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

15. Nothing Lasts Forever (1984)

Prepare for a whimsical and heartwarming journey, as “Nothing Lasts Forever” (1984) takes you on a spellbinding adventure through New York City’s Holland Tunnel and beyond. This witty and enchanting comedy-drama, directed by Tom Schiller, features a unique storyline where an aspiring artist, played by Zach Galligan, finds himself assigned the task of directing traffic in the city’s iconic landmark.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

16. The Razor’s Edge (1984)

The Razor’s Edge” (1984) is a gripping drama that takes its viewers on an emotional journey following the lives of characters whose paths intertwine unexpectedly. With a blend of romance, war, and self-discovery, the movie is based on the book of the same title by W.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

17. Ghostbusters (1984)

Ghostbusters, a heartwarming ’80s classic directed by Ivan Reitman, tells the story of a delightful yet unconventional trio — parapsychologists Dr. Peter Venkman, Dr. Raymond Stantz, and Egon Spengler. Shunned by academia, they decide to put their paranormal research skills into practice by founding a unique ghost removal service in the bustling streets of New York City.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

18. Little Shop of Horrors (1986)

Little Shop of Horrors”, a 1986 film directed by Frank Oz, has everything from comedy to horror and musical elements that will keep you hooked. The story revolves around a nerdy florist, played by Rick Moranis, who accidentally discovers and befriends an unlikely plant.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

19. Scrooged (1988)

Scrooged” is a heartwarming and hilarious reimagining of Charles Dickens’ classic tale, set in the fast-paced world of television production. The story revolves around Frank Cross, a selfish and cynical executive, played by Bill Murray, who couldn’t care less about Christmas. He plans a live broadcast of A Christmas Carol, despite his own scrooge-like attitude.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

20. She’s Having a Baby (1988)

Prepare for a rollercoaster ride of emotions as you witness the adorable newlywed couple in She’s Having a Baby! This 1988 classic, written and directed by the genius John Hughes, delves deep into the unexpected world of parenting.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

21. Ghostbusters II (1989)

Ghostbusters II brings back the beloved team of paranormal investigators for a thrilling sequel. Set in New York City, the crew discovers a massive river of ectoplasm and a resurgence of spectral activity, which sparks the revival of their Ghostbusters business. As they face new challenges and dangers, the team uses their wit and courage to protect the city from ghostly threats.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

22. Quick Change (1990)

Quick Change” is a comedic crime film released in 1990, starring Bill Murray, Geena Davis, and Randy Quaid. The story revolves around three skilled thieves who successfully rob a New York City bank. However, their mission takes an unexpected turn when they face the daunting challenge of escaping the city limits.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

23. What About Bob? (1991)

A successful psychotherapist, played by Richard Dreyfuss, finds himself at the edge of his sanity when one of his most dependent patients, an obsessive-compulsive neurotic portrayed by Bill Murray, tracks him down during his family vacation. The film follows the hilarious antics that ensue as this neurotic patient infiltrates the psychotherapist’s life, making for an unforgettable comedic adventure. Directed by Frank Oz, “What About Bob? “ is a heartwarming and hilarious tale of obsession and neurosis, featuring a star-studded cast including Julie Hagerty.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

24. Saturday Night Live: Presidential Bash (1992)

Saturday Night Live: Presidential Bash” is a hilarious comedy special that aired in 1992, bringing together some of the most iconic and memorable SNL cast members of the time, including Dana Carvey, Phil Hartman, and Dan Aykroyd. Delivering side-splitting humor, this stand-up comedy event features parody sketches, satire routines, and stand-up comedy performances that poke fun at the political landscape of the day.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

25. Groundhog Day (1993)

Groundhog Day, “ an enigmatic and heartwarming 1993 film, stars the unforgettable Bill Murray as a narcissistic meteorologist named Phil Connors. Phil finds himself trapped in a peculiar time loop, repeating the same day — Groundhog Day — over and over again. As he navigates the town of Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania, attempting to solve his predicament, Phil encounters quirky residents and discovers the depths of existentialism.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

26. Mad Dog and Glory (1993)

Mad Dog and Glory is a 1993 comedy-crime drama film directed by John McNaughton and written by Richard Price. The film stars Robert De Niro, Uma Thurman, and Bill Murray and was released by Universal Pictures.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

27. Ed Wood (1994)

Ed Wood” is a biographical comedy-drama that portrays the life of the ambitious but troubled movie director Edward D. Wood Jr. Despite his lack of talent, Wood persistently tries to fulfill his dreams in Hollywood.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

28. King of the Ring (1995)

Step into the thrilling world of the third annual King of the Ring tournament, a high-stakes wrestling event featuring some of the biggest names in the sport. Mabel, Savio Vega, Yokozuna, and The Undertaker are just a few of the fierce competitors ready to battle it out for the ultimate wrestling championship. Watch as they face off in electrifying matches, including Shawn Michaels versus Kama and Diesel & Bam Bam Bigelow versus Sycho Sid & Tatanka.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

29. Larger Than Life (1996)

In the eccentric comedy “Larger Than Life, “ Bill Murray slides into the role of a struggling motivational speaker who finds his life turned upside down when his long-lost father leaves him a priceless inheritance. . an adored circus elephant! . When Murray’s hapless speaker discovers that the huge gift isn’t just part of a joke, he takes on the challenge of caring for and bonding with his unexpected new family member.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

30. Space Jam (1996)

Space Jam (1996) is a heartwarming animated adventure comedy where the beloved animated characters, the Looney Tunes, find themselves in a desperate situation. In order to win a high stakes basketball tournament and regain their freedom, they turn to retired basketball champion, Michael Jordan. Join the hilarious trio of Bugs Bunny, Daffy Duck, and friends as they embark on a thrilling journey through an enchanting amusement park, encountering unexpected surprises and challenges along the way.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

31. Kingpin (1996)

Kingpin is a hilarious sports comedy from 1996, directed by Bobby Farrelly and Peter Farrelly. Starring Woody Harrelson, Randy Quaid, and Bill Murray, this film is a whirlwind of excitement, laughter, and unexpected twists!

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

32. The Man Who Knew Too Little (1997)

The Man Who Knew Too Little” is an entertaining and unexpected thriller starring Bill Murray as the titular character, Wallace Ritchie, an American mistaken for a secret agent. This light-hearted comedy takes place in the UK and follows Ritchie as he is mistaken for a spy and plunged into the midst of a dangerous plot to assassinate international leaders at a banquet. As the movie progresses, Ritchie must use his wits and charm to stop the deadly scheme before it’s too late.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

33. With Friends Like These (1998)

With Friends Like These” is a 1998 comedy film that follows four close-knit actors as they compete to secure a significant role in a Martin Scorsese mob film. The talented cast, starring Robert Costanzo, David Strathairn, and Adam Arkin, portray eccentric individuals who are pitted against each other for the coveted part. Philip Frank Messina takes the helm as both director and writer, bringing his unique vision to life on screen in the realm of independent cinema.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

34. Saturday Night Live: The Best of Steve Martin (1998)

Experience the unparalleled comedic genius of Steve Martin in this one-of-a-kind compilation of his finest moments on Saturday Night Live. This entertaining DVD showcases the best of Martin’s comedy sketches, parody performances, and his trademark wit, all brought to life by his extraordinary talent. Join the fun as he takes on ridiculous stereotypes, engages in hilarious wordplay, and shares his unique brand of stupidity that has captivated audiences for decades.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

35. Rushmore (1998)

Rushmore is a delightful coming-of-age comedy from Wes Anderson that dives into the world of jealousy and hidden connections. Set in Rushmore Academy, the film follows Max Fischer, a misunderstood teenager who falls for a much older teacher and befriends an eccentric middle-aged industrialist.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

36. Wild Things (1998)

In the steamy year of 1998, the erotic thriller “Wild Things” took the world by storm. Directed by the fearless John McNaughton and penned by the masterful mind of Stephen Peters, the film stars no less than Kevin Bacon, the embodiment of American charm, and the unstoppable Neve Campbell, an actress who has proven time and again that she is more than just a pretty face. Matt Dillon, an icon of the silver screen, completes this dynamic trio of acting titans.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

37. Saturday Night Live 25 (1999)

Celebrate 25 years of laughter with Saturday Night Live’s landmark 25th anniversary special! . This unforgettable TV event brings the best cast members and guest hosts back together for a night of nostalgia and side-splitting humor. As the iconic comedy show’s stellar lineup performs signature monologues and parades through decades of unforgettable sketches and musical performances, viewers are treated to a heartwarming look back on SNL’s enduring legacy and the memories that have brought joy to their households for generations.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

38. Cradle Will Rock (1999)

Cradle Will Rock” is a 1999 drama film that delves deep into the tumultuous world of politics and art in 1930s America. Directed by Tim Robbins, who also wrote the screenplay, the film focuses on a leftist musical drama, a true story set against the backdrop of Franklin D. Roosevelt’s reign.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

39. Hamlet (2000)

In the modern-day New York City streets, Hamlet comes to life in a thrilling adaptation of William Shakespeare’s timeless story. Featuring high-stakes drama, steamy romance, and chilling suspense, the film centers on the young Prince Hamlet as he embarks on a quest for vengeance against those responsible for his father’s tragic murder. As he grapples with the ghost of his father and the truth behind his father’s death, Hamlet must race against time to expose the murderer and bring justice to his family.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

40. Charlie’s Angels (2000)

Experience the thrilling, action-packed world of Charlie’s Angels, the 2000 movie that has captivated audiences with its electrifying blend of fun and adventure. Directed by McG and starring superstar actors Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore, and Lucy Liu, this film brings the famous characters to life in a whole new way.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

41. Osmosis Jones (2001)

Experience the thrilling and imaginative world of “Osmosis Jones, “ an animation-adventure filled with humor, action, and mystery. The story follows a white blood cell named Osmosis Jones as he teams up with a cold pill to save his human host, Frank, from a deadly virus. The film masterfully blends wisecrack humor with touching moments, making it an enjoyable watch for all ages.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

42. The Royal Tenenbaums (2001)

The Royal Tenenbaums is an eccentric and humorous exploration of a dysfunctional family’s reunion. Directed by Wes Anderson and written by Anderson and Owen Wilson, this touching film follows the peculiar lives of the Royal family members as they reluctantly reunite under one roof for various reasons. With a mix of comedy and drama, the movie delves into issues of family relationships, forbidden love, and the quirks that define this dysfunctional and eccentric family.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

43. Speaking of Sex (2001)

Speaking of Sex, released in 2001, is a Comedy-Romance film directed by John McNaughton and written by Gary Tieche. The movie stars James Spader, Melora Walters, and Jay Mohr and is set in Canada, the USA, and France. The plot revolves around a troubled couple seeking help from a female marriage counselor and a male depression expert to solve their marital problems.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

44. The Rutles 2: Can’t Buy Me Lunch (2003)

Twenty-six years have passed since the release of the original Rutles documentary, and now famous artists, actors, and musicians are stepping forward to share how this legendary group influenced their own careers. Directed and written by Eric Idle, The Rutles 2: Can’t Buy Me Lunch (2003) is a hilarious sequel that pays homage to the Beatles and the band’s unique impact on popular culture.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

45. Lost in Translation (2003)

Lost in Translation is a captivating film that tells the story of a unique friendship formed between an aging movie star and a young woman, both lost in their own personal struggles. Set in the bustling city of Tokyo, where the language barrier adds to their isolation, the duo find solace and companionship in each other. Directed by Sofia Coppola, this moving drama explores themes of loneliness, love, and the unexpected bonds that form when individuals are brought together by chance.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

46. Coffee and Cigarettes (2003)

Coffee and Cigarettes (2003), directed by Jim Jarmusch, is a unique and captivating film that explores the intricate world of coffee and cigarettes through a series of vignettes. The movie showcases the addictive nature and camaraderie shared by those who love their caffeine and nicotine fix.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

47. The 76th Annual Academy Awards (2004)

The 76th Annual Academy Awards, also known as the Oscars, is a prestigious annual event where the film industry comes together to celebrate cinematic achievements of the previous year. The 2004 ceremony showcases a range of nominated films, including epic masterpiece “The Return of the King, “ the poignant drama “Lost in Translation, “ the historical epic “Master and Commander, “ the gripping crime-thriller “Mystic River, “ and the heartwarming sports story “Seabiscuit. “ The event, hosted by the talented Billy Crystal, is renowned for its live performances, humorous moments, and heartwarming tributes to the film industry. This Academy Awards ceremony, held in 2004, demonstrates the extraordinary talents and contributions of the film industry in the 2000s, with a remarkable lineup of nominees and an unforgettable night of celebration.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

48. This Old Cub (2004)

This Old Cub, “ a heartwarming documentary, delves into the life and career of Ron Santo, a Chicago Cubs legend. Through intensive exploration, Jeff Santo uncovers the extraordinary journey of his father, both on and off the baseball field.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

49. Garfield: The Movie (2004)

In “Garfield: The Movie, “ the lovable lascivious cat Garfield teams up with his owner, Jon Arbuckle, in a high-stakes adventure to save Jon’s new dog, Odie, from a mysterious abduction. As viewers embark on this whimsical journey filled with humor, suspense, and heartwarming moments, they will witness Garfield’s cunning strategies, endearing antics, and powerful bond with his human and canine companions. Join the beloved cast of characters in a hilarious, animated escapade that proves you don’t need to be a superhero to save the day! .

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

50. The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou (2004)

In “The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou, “ oceanographer Steve Zissou (Bill Murray) embarks on a daring mission to avenge the death of his partner. Assembling an eclectic crew, including his estranged wife (Cate Blanchett), a journalist, and a man who might be his son, Zissou sets sail for the unknown depths of the ocean, determined to capture and destroy the mythical shark responsible for the tragedy.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

51. Broken Flowers (2005)

Broken Flowers” is a unique and captivating 2005 film directed by Jim Jarmusch, that takes viewers on an unforgettable cross-country journey. The film follows the lives of the extremely withdrawn Don Johnston, played by the legendary Bill Murray, as he navigates through his past relationships in search of answers about a potential illegitimate son he never knew he had.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

52. Saturday Night Live: The Best of John Belushi (2005)

Saturday Night Live: The Best of John Belushi” showcases the unforgettable performances and iconic characters created by the legendary comedic actor during his time on the iconic television show. This 1h 18min special highlights memorable skits featuring John Belushi and other famous cast members, such as Dan Aykroyd, Chevy Chase, and many more. Belushi’s undeniable talent and magnetic screen presence left an indelible mark on comedy, forever changing the landscape of television.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

53. Live from New York: The First 5 Years of Saturday Night Live (2005)

Live from New York: The First 5 Years of Saturday Night Live” is an entertaining and nostalgic TV special that takes viewers on a journey through the early years of the beloved late-night comedy show, Saturday Night Live (SNL). This behind-the-scenes documentary retrospective, directed by Kenneth Bowser, chronicles the early years of SNL from its inception in 1975, focusing on the show’s first five seasons.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

54. The Lost City (2005)

The Lost City, directed by Andy Garcia and released in 2006, is a heartbreaking and poignant drama that tells the story of a wealthy Havana club owner and his family. As the societal changes brought about by the transition from Fidel Castro’s Marxist revolution to Batista’s regime sweep through 1950s Cuba, the family finds themselves caught in the crossfire of the violent upheaval.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

55. Saturday Night Live: The Best of Dan Aykroyd (2005)

Step into the world of hilarity as you relive the best moments of Dan Aykroyd’s illustrious career in Saturday Night Live: The Best of Dan Aykroyd. This uproarious compilation includes an array of Aykroyd’s most cherished characters and sketches from his time on the iconic SNL stage, spanning over the first four years of the show’s epic run. Featuring collaborations with the likes of John Belushi and Steve Cropper, this timeless collection of comedy gold is guaranteed to have you laughing and reminiscing until the credits roll.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

56. Saturday Night Live: The Best of Gilda Radner (2005)

Saturday Night Live: The Best of Gilda Radner, released in 2005, is an insightful compilation of comedian Gilda Radner’s funniest skits and most memorable characters. Spanning the first five years of the iconic television show, this film showcases Radner’s impressive talent for making audiences laugh and her brilliant ability to embrace a diverse range of characters. With the help of well-known contributors like Dan Aykroyd and John Belushi, the film transports viewers back to the early days of Saturday Night Live, celebrating the timeless humor of this legendary comedian.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

57. Buy the Ticket, Take the Ride: Hunter S. Thompson on Film (2006)

Unravel the enigmatic life of legendary gonzo journalist, Hunter S. Thompson, in the riveting documentary, “Buy the Ticket, Take the Ride: Hunter S.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

58. Garfield: A Tail of Two Kitties (2006)

Garfield: A Tail of Two Kitties” is a family-friendly adventure comedy about the beloved orange cat and his owner, Jon. When an unexpected trip to the United Kingdom takes them to a castle, Garfield finds himself in the middle of a hilarious case of mistaken cat identity. Suddenly, he’s ruling over the estate, but his reign is threatened by the sinister Lord Dargis, who plans to steal the castle for himself.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

59. The Darjeeling Limited (2007)

In a journey of self-discovery and familial bonding, “The Darjeeling Limited” takes audiences on a whimsical adventure across the exotic landscapes of India. Directed by Wes Anderson and featuring the stellar cast of Owen Wilson, Adrien Brody, and Jason Schwartzman, the film tells the story of three brothers on a train traversing India, one year after the death of their father. As they embark on this quirky comedy-drama, the siblings encounter a series of eccentric characters and unexpected challenges, all while attempting to find their place in the world.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

60. Saturday Night Live in the ’90s: Pop Culture Nation (2007)

Relive the magic of the 1990s with Saturday Night Live in the ’90s: Pop Culture Nation. This enlightening documentary delves into the heart of the iconic sketch comedy series as it navigated the pop culture landscape of the decade. With interviews from the cast and crew, along with the show’s host including stars like Alec Baldwin and Christina Aguilera, this film takes you behind the scenes of the beloved show and dissects the dynamic interactions that made it a cultural phenomenon.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

61. City of Ember (2008)

City of Ember” is a heartwarming adventure set in a world filled with glittering lights, where generations of people have thrived under the powerful presence of a failing generator. As the great lamps that illuminate the city begin to flicker, two young residents, Lina and Doon, embark on a daring journey to save their beloved city from the impending apocalypse. With the help of the mysterious and enigmatic Mayor, the trio must unravel the secrets of the unknown region in order to restore the lights and save Ember from a dark and uncertain future.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

62. Gonzo (2008)

Gonzo” is a compelling biographical documentary that delves into the life and work of the iconic American gonzo journalist, Dr. Hunter S. Thompson.
